title: Yoga practice should not end with month-long campaign, Collector tells people
content: Around 5,000 people participated in the 11th International Yoga Day celebrations held at Indira Gandhi Municipal Corporation Stadium in city, according to district officials

title: Rice research institute experts urge delta farmers to choose paddy varieties suited for local conditions
content: TRRI Director K. Subrahmaniyan says TPS 5, a commonly used variety here, matures in 100 days elsewhere, it takes 125 days in the delta — causing delayed harvests, higher pest incidence, and increased costs

title: T.N. government sets up helplines for people from State affected by Israel-Iran conflict
content: Efforts have been intensified to identify those from Tamil Nadu among those who returned from the region and to ensure their safe return to the State

title: Special court in Assam orders framing of charges under POCSO, IPC against IPS officer
content: The incident, involving a 14-year-old girl, took place in December 2019 and a police case was registered in January 2020

title: L-G's office undermining democratic governance in J&K: NC Jammu chief
content: Interacting with senior party functionaries at the Sher-e-Kashmir Bhawan, Rattan Lal Gupta urged the BJP-led Centre to immediately intervene and ensure that constitutional norms are upheld in letter and spirit.

title: Anonymous devotee drops diamond into Rajampeta temple hundi
content: The market value of the diamond would be anywhere between ₹70 lakh and ₹2 crore, say local merchants

title: ONGC says significant progress made in controlling gas blowout in Assam
content: In a statement, ONGC said it "has made significant headway in its well control operations at RDS#147A, with the flow rate of gas having reduced substantially, marking a critical step forward in containment efforts."

title: Congress not a party that silences voices: K.C. Venugopal
content: If someone crosses the Lakshman Rekha, the party reserves the right to take action, Congress leader says

title: Missing filmmaker confirmed dead in Ahmedabad plane crash after DNA match; body handed over to kin
content: "To clear his family's doubts, we collected CCTV footage of that area to establish that he was indeed using that route for some time. His last mobile location was last traced close to the accident site," police officer said.

title: Sharing video footage of polling station breaches voters' privacy: EC officials
content: Sharing the footage, which would enable easy identification of the electors by any group or an individual, would leave both the elector who has voted as well the elector who has not voted vulnerable to pressure, discrimination and intimidation by anti-social elements

title: Two killed, four injured in a road accident near Kodavaluru
content: The deceased have been identified as 67-year-old Mastan Saheb and 10-year-old Ayesha, both from the same family in Hyderabad

title: COCOMI demands 'farmer safety zone' in Imphal Valley periphery areas
content: The COCOMI also demanded shoot-at-sight orders in the periphery areas of the valley to deal with any unauthorised armed intruder, especially those carrying assault rifles or deadly firearms

title: Two Guinness Records set; IYD-2025 a historic event, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The Chief Minister said a staggering 3,02,087 people have participated in the event on Saturday and the participation was voluntary

title: High courts not custodian of revenue department, says Supreme Court; stays Bombay HC order
content: The Supreme Court passed the order while hearing a plea filed by the firm, challenging the High Court order.

title: Did Israel strikes trigger earthquake in Tehran? Tremors could be linked to Iran nukes
content: An earthquake of magnitude 5.1 hit northern Iran. This event occurred amidst ongoing Israeli airstrikes. Some analysts speculate a possible link to Iran's nuclear program. Semnan province, near the epicenter, houses key nuclear and missile infrastructure. Iran denies pursuing nuclear weapons. The incident has heightened tensions in West Asia. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of the tremor.

title: Are Indians being forced to leave Israel? What embassy said
content: Amidst rising Middle East tensions, the Indian embassy in Israel refuted claims of forcing Indian citizens to leave, dismissing a fake social media post. The embassy encouraged citizens to rely on official channels for accurate updates and register for assistance.

title: Gadkari calls work done till now 'news reel'; adds 'film abhi baaki hain'
content: Nitin Gadkari hinted at a larger role in 2029, framing his past contributions as a mere "news reel" compared to the "real film" yet to come. He emphasized party loyalty and his commitment to assigned duties, while prioritizing initiatives to prevent farmer suicides in Vidarbha. Gadkari also cited population growth as a barrier to India's economic progress.

title: IND vs ENG: Emotional scenes! Shubman Gill breaks down after scoring 147
content: Shubman Gill marked his Test captaincy debut with a brilliant 147 against England at Headingley, leading India's charge in the first Test. Despite falling short of a double century due to a mistimed shot, his innings was crucial in India's quest for an early series advantage.

title: How Bill Gates and Melinda Gates reacted when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: 'Hissing door mid-air': AI flight to Hong Kong spooks flyers; crew use napkins to 'fix' issue
content: An Air India flight from Delhi to Hong Kong experienced a mid-air door malfunction, causing unsettling noises and shaking. Flight attendants used napkins to mitigate the issue, and the flight landed safely. Similar incidents have occurred on Boeing 787s previously, though experts assure that such door issues don't compromise flight safety, highlighting the redundancy in safety measures.

title: 1st Test Day 2: Is Gill still wearing black socks? What if he's found guilty?
content: Shubman Gill's impressive Test captaincy debut at Headingley was slightly overshadowed when he sported black socks, violating ICC regulations mandating white, cream, or light grey. While his career-best 147 anchored India's innings, the sock choice drew attention, potentially leading to a reprimand or fine.

title: Conginzant’s 99 paise deal: IT giant grabs 21.31 acres land in Andhra: What the deal is
content: Cognizant will establish a major IT campus in Visakhapatnam, securing 21.31 acres of land from the Andhra Pradesh government for a nominal price. The company plans to invest Rs 1,582 crore in the project, which is expected to generate 8,000 jobs over the next eight years. This move aligns with Andhra Pradesh's vision to transform Visakhapatnam into a technology hub.

title: IND vs ENG: India's highest Test totals in England: Can Shubman's team break the record at Leeds?
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut began spectacularly as India dominated England in Leeds. Yashasvi Jaiswal scored a century on his first English innings, while Gill made his maiden overseas Test century, both achieving unique milestones. India ended day one at 359/3, aiming to build a massive first-innings lead, reminiscent of their victorious 2002 Leeds performance.

title: From 'stupid, stupid' to 'superb, superb' - Gavaskar lauds Pant's hundred
content: Rishabh Pant's audacious century at Headingley marked a significant turnaround, silencing past criticism from Sunil Gavaskar. Pant's measured approach, combining patience with aggressive strokes, allowed him to dominate the tiring bowlers. His partnership with Shubman Gill put India in a commanding position, transforming critique into admiration.

title: SpaceX test rocket explosion: Elon Musk shares ‘three-word’ reply
content: A SpaceX Starship upper stage exploded during an engine test at Starbase in South Texas, resulting in the spacecraft's loss and damage to the test area. This incident occurred just before the planned 10th flight test of the massive rocket, a key component of Elon Musk's Mars colonization vision.

title: Delhi weather: Sudden rain brings relief to capital; IMD issues yellow alert
content: Delhi experienced a welcome change in weather as rain showers swept through various areas. RK Puram, Dhaula Kuan, and Delhi Cantt saw significant downpours. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert, forecasting rainfall from Friday to Monday. The monsoon is approaching the National Capital Region, with an expected arrival by June 24.

title: IND vs ENG: 3011-day wait ends in heartbreak! Karun Nair falls for four-ball duck on Test comeback
content: After an eight-year wait, Karun Nair's Test comeback was short-lived as he was dismissed for a duck by Ben Stokes. Nair, who previously scored a triple century against England in 2016, earned his recall after impressive domestic performances. Despite the disappointing return, he cherished receiving his comeback cap from Sunil Gavaskar.

title: Taylor Swift breaks from Blake Lively: Betrayal in $400M lawsuit
content: The celebrated friendship between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively is reportedly strained due to a $400 million lawsuit involving Justin Baldoni and Lively. Private text messages from Lively, presented in court, have allegedly wounded Swift, exposing a side of Lively she hadn't anticipated.

title: Dressed as inspector, 20-year-old visits Kolkata police station to impress girlfriend
content: A 20-year-old man named Diptendu Bag was apprehended at Entally Police Station for masquerading as a Bengal Police inspector. Bag, dressed in a police uniform and accompanied by his girlfriend, aroused suspicion due to his unusual behavior. His inconsistent answers during questioning and claims of a rapid promotion raised further doubts.

title: Spy chief flip-flop? After Trump's 2nd rebuke over Iran intel, Tulsi Gabbard shifts tone
content: A public dispute has erupted within the US national security apparatus as Tulsi Gabbard adjusted her assessment of Iran's nuclear ambitions, following a direct contradiction from President Trump. Gabbard now acknowledges Iran could potentially develop a nuclear weapon within weeks to months if it chooses to proceed, a revision prompted by the president's strong disagreement and amidst ongoing tensions regarding the Iran-Israel conflict.

title: 'Destroying evidence': Rahul Gandhi targets EC again; poll body reacts
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of the Election Commission, alleging a lack of transparency and the destruction of vital election data. The EC defended its decision to erase CCTV footage 45 days post-election, citing voter privacy and potential misuse. Officials stated that releasing webcasting footage could compromise voter security and contravene legal provisions, despite claims of promoting democratic integrity.

title: 'Yoga is pause button'; PM Modi's strong message for world 'going through unrest'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi led the 11th International Yoga Day celebrations in Visakhapatnam, emphasizing yoga's role in fostering peace amidst global tensions. He highlighted yoga's universal appeal, transcending boundaries and uniting humanity.

title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant breaks MS Dhoni's record, slams seventh Test century
content: Rishabh Pant's impressive record in England continued as he scored his seventh Test century at Headingley in Leeds. Pant reached his century in 119 balls, marking his slowest Test century. This was his fourth century against England and his third on English soil, solidifying his reputation as a premier red-ball batter for India.

title: 'Giving them two weeks': Trump’s timeless countdown returns; this time with Iran
content: Donald Trump has repeatedly stated he will decide whether to launch a military strike on Iran within the next two weeks. This timeline echoes a pattern from his first term, where he frequently used the "two weeks" promise for various announcements that often failed to materialize.

title: ‘Disturbing departure from moral traditions’: Sonia Gandhi on govt silence on Gaza, Iran
content: Sonia Gandhi has strongly criticized the Modi government's silence on Israel's actions in Gaza and its strike on Iran, calling it a departure from India's diplomatic traditions. She accused the government of abandoning its commitment to a two-state solution and failing to condemn Israel's escalation, urging India to use its diplomatic leverage to promote dialogue and de-escalation in West Asia.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Kya hi baat hai teri bhai' - Gill’s banter with Pant lights up Day 2
content: Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant's on-field camaraderie shone through during India's dominant batting display at Headingley. Gill's witty comment on Pant's elegant leave was caught on the stump mic, delighting fans. Pant, in turn, cautioned Gill about a risky shot, showcasing their mutual understanding and contributing to a defining 200-plus run partnership.

title: 'Serious lapses': DGCA orders Air India to remove 3 top officials; issues show-cause notice
content: Following the tragic Air India Flight AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation has directed Air India to remove three senior officials from crew scheduling roles. The crash, involving a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, resulted in 241 fatalities.

title: Forest dept, Mumbai civic body visit SRK's home over violation complaints
content: Following a complaint about potential coastal regulation zone violations during renovations, a joint team of forest department and BMC officials inspected Shah Rukh Khan's bungalow, Mannat. The inspection included both the heritage structure and the annex building. Officials will prepare a report based on their findings after reviewing documents provided by Khan's staff regarding the permissions obtained for the renovation.

title: Beacon of honesty: Auto driver returns Rs 17 lakh left behind by Myanmar bizman
content: In Mizoram's Lawngtlai, a selfless act occurred. Lalhmingmuana, an auto-rickshaw driver, found a bag with Rs 17 lakh. The money belonged to a Myanmar businessman who forgot it in the auto. Lalhmingmuana returned the entire sum. He expected nothing in return. The Lawngtlai Auto Rickshaw Owners' Association praised his honesty. His action restored faith and set a great example.

title: Odisha dept transfers doctor 2 months after death; asks officer to join immediately
content: In a bizarre oversight, the health department in Sundargarh district promoted Dr. Smruti Ranjan Samal, a block public health officer who passed away in April, to additional public health officer (TB). The order, issued amidst a cholera outbreak, also transferred the deceased doctor to the district headquarters hospital. Officials attribute the error to a communication lapse regarding Samal's death.

title: Air India crash crew member Irfan Shaikh laid to rest after DNA match
content: Irfan Shaikh, a 22-year-old Air India crew member who perished in the Ahmedabad plane crash last week, was laid to rest in Pimpri Chinchwad on Saturday. His remains were identified through DNA matching. The London-bound AI 171 crashed shortly after takeoff, killing all 241 on board and 29 on the ground.

title: 'Will never permit': J&K CM on Indus diversion to Punjab; ally Cong fumes
content: A dispute has erupted among northern states over the central government's plan to divert surplus water from the Indus system. Jammu and Kashmir's chief minister Omar Abdullah opposes redirecting water to Punjab, citing drought-like conditions in his region. This stance has drawn criticism from Punjab's Congress MP, who emphasised Punjab's patriotism and contributions to national security.

title: 'Maybe US wants to attack anyway': Iran foreign minister on Trump's 2-week window
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi suggests the United States might be using negotiations as a cover for a planned attack on Iran, questioning America's commitment to diplomacy. He accuses Washington of betrayal, especially after Israel's strikes on Iranian nuclear targets just before scheduled talks. Araghchi states Iran is willing to negotiate, but demands Israel cease its aerial attacks first.

title: IND vs ENG: Did Shubman Gill break rules? ICC rulebook provides clarity
content: Shubman Gill's impressive Test captaincy debut, marked by a brilliant century against England, is slightly overshadowed by a potential ICC violation. Gill was seen wearing black socks, breaching regulations that mandate white, cream, or light grey socks. This fashion faux pas could lead to a reprimand or fine, despite his stellar performance and India's dominant position at 359/3 at stumps.

title: Man hacked to death for urinating near chicken shop
content: In Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, a dispute over public urination near a poultry shop escalated into a fatal cleaver attack, resulting in the death of Nitin Sankpal and injuries to two others. Police arrested five individuals, including the shop owner, Mastan Qureshi.

title: IND vs ENG: Stuart Broad rips into England bowlers, says 'they didn't quite get it right'
content: Shubman Gill's unbeaten century, complemented by Yashasvi Jaiswal's ton, propelled India to a dominant position on Day 1 of the opening Test against England at Headingley. India finished at 359 for 3 after being put into bat, with Rishabh Pant adding late fireworks. Stuart Broad criticized England's bowling tactics, suggesting adjustments to their field settings and lengths.

title: Watch: Moment Israel kills Iran’s ‘weapons kingpin’ in deep strike inside Tehran
content: The IDF announced the killing of Behnam Shahriyari, commander of the Quds Force's Weapons Transfer Unit, responsible for funneling weapons and funds to Iranian proxies. Saeed Izadi, a senior IRGC commander and key liaison with Hamas, was also eliminated in a separate strike.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Neeche hi reh ... ' - Rishabh Pant's stump-mic warning to Shubman Gill goes viral during Leeds Test
content: India dominated day one of the first Test against England, concluding at 359/3. Shubman Gill led with an unbeaten 127, supported by Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and Rishabh Pant's aggressive 65. Pant even advised caution to Gill, captured by the stump mic. This strong start marks a promising beginning for India in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, showcasing their batting prowess.

title: 'Who are you?' AI voices answer calls of Iranian disapora trying to contact kin
content: Following Israeli airstrikes on Iran, Iranians abroad are met with robotic voices when calling home due to a widespread communication blackout. These AI messages, ranging from unsettling to strangely comforting, are suspected to be a government tactic to prevent hacking or spread confusion.

title: Banarasi sarees: What makes them special? Here are 10 reasons for their everlasting charm
content: Banarasi sarees, originating from Varanasi, are exquisite silk heirlooms steeped in history and culture, blending Indian traditions with Mughal artistry. These sarees, known for intricate craftsmanship and luxurious fabrics like silk and zari, feature diverse styles and motifs, holding cultural significance and social status. Despite challenges from machine-made imitations, initiatives promote sustainability to preserve this timeless craft.

title: 'Israel spreading terror': Slip-up by US envoy to UN goes viral; watch video
content: A US diplomat, Dorothy Shea, created a stir at a UN Security Council meeting by mistakenly blaming Israel for regional chaos before correcting herself to point the finger at Iran. Despite the gaffe, Shea reaffirmed US support for Israel, particularly regarding actions against Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Bhaiya yaar...' - Watch Jaiswal's frustrated reaction after Gill says 'no'
content: India dominated Day 1 of the first Test against England, reaching 359 for 3 at stumps, thanks to centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill. The pair's 123-run partnership steadied the innings after India lost two quick wickets. A near run-out incident involving Gill added drama, followed by lighthearted banter between Jaiswal and Gill regarding running between the wickets.

title: IND vs ENG: 'He comes from Punjab ...' - Bharat Army's new song for Gill
content: Shubman Gill, facing initial skepticism as India's Test captain, silenced critics with a remarkable unbeaten century on the first day of the Leeds Test. Alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal's century, Gill propelled India to a strong position of 359 for 3 at stumps. Gill's achievement places him among Indian legends who scored centuries in their first Test as captain.

title: 'Because it became public?': Priyank Kharge questions MEA's 'U-turn' on US visit
content: Priyanka Kharge, Karnataka minister, announced that the Union government reversed its decision. He received permission for an official US visit. The Ministry of External Affairs issued an NOC after initially denying clearance. Kharge questioned the initial denial and timing. He highlighted Karnataka's role in national initiatives. He also emphasized the need for answers from the central government regarding the matter.

title: SBI reopens officer jobs: Class 10/12 English now counts; 2,964 posts up for grabs
content: The State Bank of India (SBI) has reopened applications for 2,964 Circle Based Officer (CBO) posts under Advertisement No. CRPD/CBO/2025-26/03. Candidates from Arunachal Pradesh and Nagaland with English as a subject in Class 10 or 12 are now eligible for the North East Circle. The application window is open from June 21 to June 30, 2025. Selection involves an Online Test, Interview, and Language Test. Eligible candidates must have a graduate degree and two years of officer-level experience.

title: Kanishka bombing: Canada police identifies 'Mr X'; refuses to disclose his name
content: The RCMP has identified "Mr. X," who assisted in testing the bomb weeks before the 1985 Kanishka bombing. Despite identifying him, his name remains undisclosed due to privacy laws, even after his death. This revelation comes as the 40th anniversary of the tragedy approaches, where 329 lives were lost when the Air India flight exploded off the coast of Ireland.

title: Pics: Nearby Sculptor Galaxy Revealed In Ultra-Detailed Galactic Image
content: Astronomers have released an ultra-detailed image of the Sculptor galaxy obtained with 50 hours of observations using one of the world's biggest telescopes.

title: IndiGo Flight Declared 'Mayday' Due To Low Fuel, Landed Safely: Sources
content: Budget carrier IndiGo's Guwahati-Chennai flight had to make an emergency landing in Bengaluru after the pilots declared 'mayday', said sources. The incident comes just a week after Air India flight to London crashed shortly after take-off in Gujarat.

title: Earthquake Of Magnitude 5.1 Hits Iran, Sparks Theories Of Nuclear Testing
content: The earthquake has now triggered a wave of speculations about whether Tehran has tested a nuclear weapon. It has also sparked concern because it struck near a city with a space and missile complex.

title: Venice Divided Ahead Of Jeff Bezos-Laura Sanchez's 'Wedding Of The Century'
content: Venice is divided ahead of next week's celebrity wedding of US tech-tycoon Jeff Bezos and Laura Sanchez, with some looking forward to the glitz and glamour, while others fear it will turn the scenic city of gondolas and palazzi into an amusement park

title: CBI Extradites Gujarat Man From UAE Accused In Rs 3.66 Crore Cheating Case
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), with assistance from INTERPOL and law enforcement authorities in the United Arab Emirates (UAE), has successfully secured the return of Upavan Pavan Jain, a key accused in a multi-crore cheating case.

title: Andhra Teen 8 Months Pregnant After Being Raped By 14 For 2 Years
content: A 15-year-old girl in Andhra Pradesh was repeatedly raped by 14 men over two years and has now been admitted to the hospital after she was found to be pregnant.

title: Tulsi Gabbard's Clarification On Iran After Trump's 2nd Rebuke In A Week
content: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard on Saturday said the US believes that Iran could have a nuclear weapon built "within weeks to months", hours after she was snubbed by President Donald Trump.

title: 23 Global Records Set On Yoga Day In Visakhapatnam: Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Saturday said here that the state set 23 global records - two Guinness Records and 21 World Book of Records - on the 11th International Yoga Day on Saturday.

title: Indian Workers In Israel Being Forced To Return? What Government Said
content: The government, putting an end to rumours, said that no Indian workers in Israel would be forced to return to their home country.

title: "Film Shuru Hona Baaki Hai": Nitin Gadkari On His Role In 2029 Polls
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari on Saturday replied to a query on his role in 2029 (general elections) by claiming what was seen in the past 11 years was just a "news reel" and the "real film" was yet to come.

title: "Contrary To Voter Privacy": Poll Body Sources On Voting Footage Demands
content: Countering demands that footage from poll booths be retained for more than 45 days, the Election Commission sources have said that while they seem reasonable on the face of it, they will adversely impact the privacy and security of voters.

title: In Faridabad Shocker, Father-In-Law Confesses To Killing, Burying Woman
content: The body of 24-year-old Tanu Singh was exhumed from a pit in front of her marital home in Haryana's Faridabad, nearly two months after she was allegedly murdered and buried by her father-in-law.

title: CBI Names Ex-Officials Of Tata Firm In Alleged Rs 800 Crore Port Scam
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a case against former officials of Tata Consulting Engineers (TCE) and Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (JNPT) over alleged irregularities worth over Rs 800 crore in the Capital Dredging Project.

title: UP Man Arranges Wife's Marriage To 'Lover', She Claims It Was Forced
content: A man arranged the wedding of his wife of fifteen years to another man here in a village, and said he wanted to have no ties to her, claiming she tried to poison him and offer drugs to their son.

title: Andhra Created 2 World Records In Yoga, Surya Namaskaram: Chief Minister
content: Describing the 11th International Yoga Day celebration as a grand success, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Saturday said the state has achieved two Guinness Book of World Records.

title: "Israel Has Also Spread Chaos": Video Of US Envoy's Freudian Slip Goes Viral
content: US Ambassador to the United Nations Camille Shea on Friday blamed Israel for spreading chaos and terror before realising it was a Freudian slip. Ms Shea then corrected herself, replacing "Israel" with "Iran".

title: Man Linked To Babbar Khalsa Terror Group Arrested In Punjab, 6 Pistols Seized
content: The Punjab Police on Saturday busted a terror module linked to the banned outfit Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) in Amritsar.

title: US-Iran Nuclear Talks A "Cover Up" For Israel Attack: Iran's Foreign Minister
content: When asked if the two-week time frame given by US President Donald Trump is enough to finalise a deal with the United States, Araghchi said that it was up to the Trump administration to "show their determination for going for a negotiated solution."

title: Shah Rukh Khan's 'Mannat' Inspected Over Coastal Rules Violation Complaint
content: Officials of Mumbai's civic body, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), and the forest department have inspected actor Shah Rukh Khan's sea-facing bungalow 'Mannat' after a complaint of alleged violation of the Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ).

title: 'Iran Will Destroy Zionism': Israel PM Shares Father's 2010 Speech On Tehran
content: In his speech delivered on his 100th birthday, Benzion Netanyahu warned his son and Israel about the existential threat to Jews from Iran.

title: Will move SC if there is inordinate delay in restoration of statehood to J&K: Farooq Abdullah
content: “After the elections, people wanted their issues to be resolved immediately, but statehood (not being restored) is stopping us”, said Farooq Abdullah

title: Housing scam in Karnataka: Another audio clip goes viral, PA of Nagthan MLA clarifies it is not his voice
content: In the audio clip, the MLA’s personal assistant is reportedly heard admitting to paying bribes to secure houses for the beneficiaries

title: 'Match is fixed': Rahul Gandhi alleges Election Commission 'deleting evidence' instead of giving answers
content: Mr. Gandhi has been demanding voter lists, poll data and video footage from the election commission, alleging irregularities in Maharashtra assembly elections.

title: In-laws kill, bury woman over dowry in Faridabad; whole family booked
content: Police have booked at Palla Police Station four of the in-laws' family – Bhoop Singh, originally from UP's Mainpuri, his wife Sonia, son Arun Singh, and daughter Kajal

title: CBI registers case against former Chief Manager of JNPA and private entities over ₹800 cr. alleged scam
content: According to CBI’s officials, the case was registered on June 18, 2025, on allegation that criminal conspiracy was hatched amongst JNPA officials and private persons and entities, which caused the loss.

title: Tamil Nadu Government’s initiative to train tribal students for exams such as JEE, AIEEE be renewed, demands activist Karthik
content: Activist Karthik said the G.O. published on October 15, 2013, enabled training 50 tribal students for two years in private coaching centres at a cost of ₹2 lakh per student

title: Odisha floods: 50,000 people affected by flash flood in Subarnarekha River
content: Flash flood in Subarnarekha River affects 50,000 people in Odisha’s Balasore district, relief operations underway

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Plea in Madras High Court insists on inquiring Annamalai to find out who is that ‘sir’
content: Litigant says, it is necessary to inquire former BJP State president since he claims to be in possession of incriminating materials

title: Ahmedabad Air India plane crash: Last rites of crew member Irfan Shaikh held in Pimpri Chinchwad
content: The Shaikh family received 22-year-old Irfan’s remains after a DNA match on June 20, and they were brought to Pune in the early hours of the day

title: Rajnath Singh briefed by top military brass on border security, arrangements for Amarnath
content: Chief of the Army Staff General Upendra Dwivedi, General Officer Commanding-in-Chief, Northern Command Lt Gen Pratik Sharma and other senior officers including commanding officers of all units attended the meeting

title: Ensure treatment of ailing jailed separatist leader Shabir Shah, allow family to meet him: Mirwaiz, Mehbooba to Centre
content: Hurriyat chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq said incarcerated separatist Shabir Shah’s wife had filed a bail plea “on his grave medical condition”, but was rejected

title: India set to integrate rare blood donor registry with e-Rakt Kosh
content: The integration will allow those with rare blood groups to access a centralized system developed under the National Health Mission (NHS), providing details on blood banks, blood availability, and blood donation camps across the country.

title: Process of reviving Salem Steel Plant at preliminary stage: Union Minister H.D. Kumaraswamy
content: The Union Minister participated in the International Yoga Day celebrations at Salem Steel Plant and performed asanas

title: Yoga has become a mass movement in Andhra Pradesh: CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Speaking at the International Day of Yoga – 2025 (IDY-2025) celebrations on the Beach Road, Mr. Naidu said yoga promotes holistic well-being of the practitioner.

title: How PM Modi celebrated International Yoga Day since 2015
content: Recognising its universal appeal, on December 11, 2014, the United Nations proclaimed June 21 as the International Day of Yoga by resolution 69/131.

title: Participants in jubilant mood after their yoga performance with PM Modi, CM Naidu in Vizag
content: Officials of Vizianagaram and Srikakulam districts expressed happiness with the participation of more than 50,000 common people of the region in the celebrations organised in Visakhapatnam.

title: In a stern warning, DGCA asks Air India to remove executives overseeing crew, their duty hours
content: Regulator says airline must take disciplinary action; warns future violations could result on a ban on Air India from flying

title: Extension of Kochi Water Metro service proposed in developing Kadambrayar as a tourism destination
content: This was among the few recommendations that were included in a Detailed Project Report for the proposed enhancement of Kadambrayar tourism destination centre

title: In poll-bound Bihar, Nitish Kumar increases pension to ₹1,100 per month from ₹400
content: The announcement is seen to counter the promises by the opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav. All beneficiaries will receive the revised pension starting from the month of July

title: Four militants arrested in Manipur
content: The police also apprehended a member of the outlawed PLA from Kakching Turel Wangma in Kakching district on Friday

title: Moral policing shadows couples in Chennai
content: Many young men and women complain of similar experiences of being victims of the moral police brigade, that have left them traumatised

title: DPR proposes multi-pronged infrastructure facelift for developing Kadambrayar as a tourism destination
content: Developing Kayaking routes along designated stretches of the Kadambrayar River is one of the proposals to promote eco-tourism and attract adventure seekers.

title: Madras High Court’s 133-year-old heritage building gets a new lease of life
content: A committee comprising Justices R. Subramanian, R. Suresh Kumar, P.T. Asha and N. Mala restore the long neglected ground floor of the two-storey building

title: High tension tower in middle of road bothering Hebbal residents for years
content: When trucks and buses pass through the tower, the top of the vehicles collide with the metal bars of the electric construct that not only deform the bars, but also create sharp blaring noises, especially at night

title: International Yoga Day 2025: A sea of humanity descends on Beach Road in Visakhapatnam

title: Sowing seeds of mistrust in Assam
content: The Muslim-majority district of Dhubri, in Assam, close to the Bangladesh border, has remained largely calm after experiencing some fraught periods following the demolition of the Babri Masjid in 1992. This month, however, cattle body parts were allegedly found at a Hanuman temple on successive days, sparking communal tensions. Rahul Karmakar reports on a district on edge

title: Misiorowski perfect into 7th, sets rookie record

title: Suarez, managers suspended for Padres-L.A. feud
